channel.title: Another sig
channel.description:
I did something wrong, can you guys see it, and no smart talk.
[img]http://img158.imageshack.us/img158/7494/ultimawarriortj6.png[/img]
try to find what i did wrong, + comment and rate

item.title: Another sig
item.dc:creator: @billygotshot billygotshot
item.description:
@billygotshot wrote:

lol why is one half of the sig rounded and the other half square wtf?

Read full topic

item.title: Another sig
item.dc:creator: @exe626 exe626
item.description:
@exe626 wrote:

[quote=“fellixombc, post:1, topic:134171”]I did something wrong, can you guys see it, and no smart talk.

try to find what i did wrong, + comment and rate[/quote]It has the EXACT same problems I stated before, don’t you listen to C&C when you ask for it? Btw, exps is right. All you do is epic brushing and call it vector, vector is simple and easy on the eyes. Quite frankly I can’t even see what the render is. You have a rainbow in the upper right corner(WTF?) and epic brushing everywhere else. Like I stated before, Brush FROM the render, not everywhere like that. You want your render that your using(if your using one) to stand out, its your focal point(Point where you want people to pay attention too, you want it to grab their attention). Brushing randomly in the corners, and ALL over the render isn’t helping. The you have this random light brushed right next to the render, which I don’t get not one bit;
I rate 3/10

Read full topic

item.title: Another sig
item.dc:creator: @exps35 exps35
item.description:
@exps35 wrote:

[quote=“welshy, post:6, topic:134171”][quote author=fellixombc link=topic=185553.msg1679566#msg1679566 date=1187301194]

One thing you did wrong was that you re-used the same background from your ultima vector.
Also, you should really consider keeping the render in a nice state, and without all that brushing on top of it. And lastly, If you are making ‘vectors’, vectoring out your render first will make the outcome a bit more pleasing. Just my opinion on the render though.

no, you do not understand vector, its good if vectors go over him, aslong it dosent the face
[/quote] You dont get vector either[/quote]
Yessir.

Theres no ‘definition’ for a vector, as it has no boundaries nor rules. Just the ‘idea’ of how people believe it looks best. You just simply must have, the literal meaning of a vector sig, ‘vectors’ in it.
“A directed line segment. As such, vectors have magnitude and direction. Many physical quantities, for example, velocity, acceleration, and force, are vectors. Vectors are widely used in mathematical physics. See also Calculus of vectors.”

Just more simply put, arrows of some sort. It has evolved into using numerous brushes, which still is ok in my books.

The only real ‘rule’ (or guideline for that matter) that still applies, is that of which applies in every sig you ever make: Do not cover the render in any form of which destroys it, leaving the viewer in confusion on what it actually was to start with.

Read full topic

item.title: Another sig
item.dc:creator: @wixter wixter
item.description:
@wixter wrote:

[quote=“fellixombc, post:3, topic:134171”][quote author=exps35 link=topic=185553.msg1679505#msg1679505 date=1187299898]
One thing you did wrong was that you re-used the same background from your ultima vector.
Also, you should really consider keeping the render in a nice state, and without all that brushing on top of it. And lastly, If you are making ‘vectors’, vectoring out your render first will make the outcome a bit more pleasing. Just my opinion on the render though.
[/quote]
no, you do not understand vector, its good if vectors go over him, aslong it dosent the face[/quote]
Yes but dont make it too messy. Use a soft brush to erase bits which make the sig seem overcrowded, also , take out the lighting effect above the render and add a gradient map or too,this will help the colours blend more and give your sig a little depth :). I’d say your getting better though , just try not to overcrowd your image =P.

Read full topic
